wholesale,Indeed,pj_d35bae3b474933e9,Logistics Wholesale Partner Coordinator,Hunkemller, Hilversum,"In this role, you will independently carry out operational work together with your colleagues. You are in contact with external parties such as: Logistic Service Providers, Wholesale/Concession partners and transporters. You will also be in contact with internal parties such as: the Distribution Centre, Financial Administration, Import / Export, Merchandise, Purchasing and E-commerce.
Join our journey to be a loved, social & inclusive brand and contribute to our success by performing these tasks:
Main area 1:
Managing and processing orders from Wholesale (including Zalando, ASOS, BOL) and Concession partners (including Wehkamp, Amazon).
Registering and preparing deliveries to Ecom partners
Taking care of recalls from the Ecom partners
Handling logistical complaints such as defects, delivery, late delivery, damage etc. from or by shops/Ecom partners or carriers
Over time, replenishment data from night processing for the production process in the DC will also be processed
Main area 2:
If necessary, support other department-oriented activities such as container planning, etc.
Customer-oriented and effective communication with internal and external customers
Contributes to the optimization of the (administrative) processes
Planning work and coordinating colleagues within set frameworks, setting priorities and monitoring progress
The ideal candidate has:
At least a MBO study
Knowledge of SAP or similar system and MS Office
Good knowledge of the English language and Dutch
At least 2 years of work experience in a similar position
High degree of accuracy
Customer-oriented thinking and working
Logistical experience is an advantage

Hunkemöller strives to be a much loved social & inclusive brand. A place where people love to work, are proud of the brand, and where we create true brand ambassadors. Working in a passionate, energetic, design-led and performance-driven environment where our key customer persona 'Shero' sits at the heart of everything we do. Hunkemöller is certified TOP EMPLOYER of the Netherlands 2021, which underlines our people initiatives and achievements.

Together Tomorrow – Join a Retailer that's on the move to be better for our planet, better for people, better together! From diversity & inclusion, reducing waste, to product care and how we work with our suppliers, our Together Tomorrow initiative reflects what we do and helps drive change across our business. Ready to help us achieving our ambitious goals? Where ever you'll start working with us, if in Stores or our HQs, you can contribute!
Apply now with your CV or LinkedIn profile only.
For this role, we're not looking to work with external agencies.

Our Logistics department is looking for a Logistics Wholesale Partner Coordinator, who is responsible for the administration of the Hunkemöller flow of goods and is responsible for logistics service regarding to the stores and wholesales partners. Are you the type of person who gets things done and keeps his or her head calm? wholesale,Indeed,p_46ffaf262b4e051b,Logistics Wholesale Partner Coordinator,Hunkemller, Hilversum,"In this role, you will independently carry out operational work together with your colleagues. You are in contact with external parties such as: Logistic Service Providers, Wholesale/Concession partners and transporters. You will also be in contact with internal parties such as: the Distribution Centre, Financial Administration, Import / Export, Merchandise, Purchasing and E-commerce.
Join our journey to be a loved, social & inclusive brand and contribute to our success by performing these tasks:
Main area 1:
Managing and processing orders from Wholesale (including Zalando, ASOS, BOL) and Concession partners (including Wehkamp, Amazon).
Registering and preparing deliveries to Ecom partners
Taking care of recalls from the Ecom partners
Handling logistical complaints such as defects, delivery, late delivery, damage etc. from or by shops/Ecom partners or carriers
Over time, replenishment data from night processing for the production process in the DC will also be processed
Main area 2:
If necessary, support other department-oriented activities such as container planning, etc.
Customer-oriented and effective communication with internal and external customers
Contributes to the optimization of the (administrative) processes
Planning work and coordinating colleagues within set frameworks, setting priorities and monitoring progress
The ideal candidate has:
At least a MBO study
Knowledge of SAP or similar system and MS Office
Good knowledge of the English language and Dutch
At least 2 years of work experience in a similar position
High degree of accuracy
Customer-oriented thinking and working
Logistical experience is an advantage

Hunkemöller strives to be a much loved social & inclusive brand. A place where people love to work, are proud of the brand, and where we create true brand ambassadors. Working in a passionate, energetic, design-led and performance-driven environment where our key customer persona 'Shero' sits at the heart of everything we do. Hunkemöller is certified TOP EMPLOYER of the Netherlands 2021, which underlines our people initiatives and achievements.

Together Tomorrow – Join a Retailer that's on the move to be better for our planet, better for people, better together! From diversity & inclusion, reducing waste, to product care and how we work with our suppliers, our Together Tomorrow initiative reflects what we do and helps drive change across our business. Ready to help us achieving our ambitious goals? Where ever you'll start working with us, if in Stores or our HQs, you can contribute!
Apply now with your CV or LinkedIn profile only.
For this role, we're not looking to work with external agencies.

wholesale,Indeed,p_81d94b5c2d7b5208,Logistics Manager Europe,Greenlane, Amsterdam West,"Greenlane EU is looking for a Logistics Manager to lead all aspects of Greenlane’s European logistical operation, including the shipping and fulfillment operations across all channels of the business.

This position coordinates in the administrative operations with the 3PL, business planning associated with the 3PL and logistics, shipping negotiations with the carriers, and budgeting efforts to provides both operational and programmatic support to the organization.
The Logistics Manager reports to the Director of Operations Europe and directly assists on all strategic and tactical matters as they relate to management of the company.
Who are we?

Greenlane (NASDAQ: GNLN), founded in 2005, is the leading distributor of premium brands in the burgeoning head shop, smoke shop, and dispensary channels. We devise bespoke go-to-market solutions as well as sales and marketing strategies for the best products in the industry and aid their manufacturers at every turn of the product life cycle. We have operations in seven North American cities including six highly automated distribution centers. We also own and operate several leading e-commerce websites, and brick and mortar retail outlets and since October 1st 2019 we are the proud owners of a European office and distribution center in Amsterdam. With over 60 people currently working from Amsterdam, we try to expand our global footprint rapidly.

We work in a fast-paced and competitive industry that demands hard work and dedication, but we have built a unique company culture that allows our growing team of more than three hundred to support our success, each other, and surpass our goals all while having fun. Greenlane promotes from within, allowing driven candidates the ability to earn progressive roles and responsibilities.
What are the duties of the Logistics Manager?
The main duties of this position include, but are not limited to:
Responsible for the day-to-day relationship with the 3PL
Facilitate and ensure 3PL operations SLAs are met from the Greenlane perspective
Develop and maintain operational metrics/KPIs/scorecards
Organize all aspects of shipping from Country of Origin to the 3PL and select optimal carriers from 3PL to Customers per country
Oversee 3PL operating budget and work with management to ensure success
Create operational processes and apply continuous improvement methodology to support the business
Problem solve and troubleshoot operational issues to best support the business, including through cost analysis
Identify operational issues, find the root cause and take corrective action
Support all company infrastructure projects
Manage inventory with appropriate controls
Other duties as assigned by manager or designee
The Logistics Manager should have the following competencies:
Communication Skills - business proficient oral and verbal communications skills.

Interpersonal skills – exhibits care and concern for consumer issues, maintains confidentiality, exhibits tact and diplomacy, understands and practices ethical behavior, remains open to others ideas and exhibits willingness to try new things.
Planning and organizing – prioritizes and plans work activities and uses time efficiently. Possess problem solving skills and has a sense of responsibility.
Product and industry knowledge – deep knowledge of Greenlane’s product and industry developments
Quality control – demonstrates accuracy and thoroughness and monitors own work to ensure quality.
Adaptability – adapts to changes in the work environment, manages competing demands and is able to deal with frequent change, delays or unexpected events.
Dependability – is consistently at work and on time, follows instructions, responds to management direction and solicits feedback to improve performance.
Accuracy – must possess attention to detail.
Team Player – able to work within a team, but function individually
Our ideal Logistics Manager has the following skills and experience:
A proven track record in logistics
Experience managing 3PL operations
Experience with various WMS and Shipping systems
Experience with Microsoft D365, or other high-end ERP preferred
Contracting, negotiating, and change management
Accounting, budgeting, and cost control principles
5 to 10 years of professional experience, preferably in an international mid-sized company with a global product range
Experience in both B2C (eCommerce) and/or Wholesale with a broad collection of products (1000+)
Excellent time management and negotiation skills
Ability to work effectively with cross-functional teams
Proven experience in planning and execution
Preferably a degree (MBO-HBO) in logistics
Excellent knowledge of Dutch and English language, spoken and written
Residing in Amsterdam or surroundings.
If you feel that this vacancy was written just for you and you tick all the boxes.. we want you!
We will reach out to you within two weeks (14 days) after submitting your application to provide you with feedback.

Greenlane promotes Equal Employment Opportunities.",-1,-1,https://indeed.nl/rc/clk?jk=81d94b5c2d7b5208&from=vj&mvj=0&vjfrom=vjs&pos=bottom&astse=b6003b8a66dbb272&assa=380,https://nl.indeed.com/vacature-bekijken?jk=81d94b5c2d7b5208&fccid=c7a5401d1c2f008d&vjs=3,9 dagen geleden,9 dagen geleden,2021-04-23

Who are we?

Greenlane (NASDAQ: GNLN), founded in 2005, is the leading distributor of premium brands in the burgeoning head shop, smoke shop, and dispensary channels. We devise bespoke go-to-market solutions as well as sales and marketing strategies for the best products in the industry and aid their manufacturers at every turn of the product life cycle. We have operations in seven North American cities including six highly automated distribution centers. We also own and operate several leading e-commerce websites, and brick and mortar retail outlets and since October 1st 2019 we are the proud owners of a European office and distribution center in Amsterdam. With over 60 people currently working from Amsterdam, we try to expand our global footprint rapidly.

We work in a fast-paced and competitive industry that demands hard work and dedication, but we have built a unique company culture that allows our growing team of more than three hundred to support our success, each other, and surpass our goals all while having fun. What are the duties of the Logistics Manager?
The main duties of this position include, but are not limited to:
Responsible for the day-to-day relationship with the 3PL
Facilitate and ensure 3PL operations SLAs are met from the Greenlane perspective
Develop and maintain operational metrics/KPIs/scorecards
Organize all aspects of shipping from Country of Origin to the 3PL and select optimal carriers from 3PL to Customers per country
Oversee 3PL operating budget and work with management to ensure success
Create operational processes and apply continuous improvement methodology to support the business
Problem solve and troubleshoot operational issues to best support the business, including through cost analysis
Identify operational issues, find the root cause and take corrective action
Support all company infrastructure projects
Manage inventory with appropriate controls
Other duties as assigned by manager or designee
The Logistics Manager should have the following competencies:
Communication Skills - business proficient oral and verbal communications skills.

Interpersonal skills – exhibits care and concern for consumer issues, maintains confidentiality, exhibits tact and diplomacy, understands and practices ethical behavior, remains open to others ideas and exhibits willingness to try new things.
Planning and organizing – prioritizes and plans work activities and uses time efficiently. Possess problem solving skills and has a sense of responsibility.
Product and industry knowledge – deep knowledge of Greenlane’s product and industry developments
Quality control – demonstrates accuracy and thoroughness and monitors own work to ensure quality.
Adaptability – adapts to changes in the work environment, manages competing demands and is able to deal with frequent change, delays or unexpected events.
Dependability – is consistently at work and on time, follows instructions, responds to management direction and solicits feedback to improve performance.
Accuracy – must possess attention to detail.
Team Player – able to work within a team, but function individually
Our ideal Logistics Manager has the following skills and experience:
A proven track record in logistics
Experience managing 3PL operations
Experience with various WMS and Shipping systems
Experience with Microsoft D365, or other high-end ERP preferred
Contracting, negotiating, and change management
Accounting, budgeting, and cost control principles
5 to 10 years of professional experience, preferably in an international mid-sized company with a global product range
Experience in both B2C (eCommerce) and/or Wholesale with a broad collection of products (1000+)
Excellent time management and negotiation skills
Ability to work effectively with cross-functional teams
Proven experience in planning and execution

Product and industry knowledge – deep knowledge of Greenlane’s product and industry developments
Quality control – demonstrates accuracy and thoroughness and monitors own work to ensure quality.
Adaptability – adapts to changes in the work environment, manages competing demands and is able to deal with frequent change, delays or unexpected events.
Dependability – is consistently at work and on time, follows instructions, responds to management direction and solicits feedback to improve performance.
Accuracy – must possess attention to detail.
Team Player – able to work within a team, but function individually
Our ideal Logistics Manager has the following skills and experience:
A proven track record in logistics
Experience managing 3PL operations
Experience with various WMS and Shipping systems
Experience with Microsoft D365, or other high-end ERP preferred
Contracting, negotiating, and change management
Accounting, budgeting, and cost control principles
5 to 10 years of professional experience, preferably in an international mid-sized company with a global product range
Experience in both B2C (eCommerce) and/or Wholesale with a broad collection of products (1000+)
Excellent time management and negotiation skills
Ability to work effectively with cross-functional teams
Proven experience in planning and execution
Preferably a degree (MBO-HBO) in logistics
Excellent knowledge of Dutch and English language, spoken and written
Residing in Amsterdam or surroundings.
If you feel that this vacancy was written just for you and you tick all the boxes.. we want you!
We will reach out to you within two weeks (14 days) after submitting your application to provide you with feedback.

wholesale,Indeed,p_da610602251e4b05,Logistics Manager Europe,Greenlane, Amsterdam West,"Greenlane EU is looking for a Logistics Manager to lead all aspects of Greenlane’s European logistical operation, including the shipping and fulfillment operations across all channels of the business.

This position coordinates in the administrative operations with the 3PL, business planning associated with the 3PL and logistics, shipping negotiations with the carriers, and budgeting efforts to provides both operational and programmatic support to the organization.
The Logistics Manager reports to the Director of Operations Europe and directly assists on all strategic and tactical matters as they relate to management of the company.
Who are we?

Greenlane (NASDAQ: GNLN), founded in 2005, is the leading distributor of premium brands in the burgeoning head shop, smoke shop, and dispensary channels. We devise bespoke go-to-market solutions as well as sales and marketing strategies for the best products in the industry and aid their manufacturers at every turn of the product life cycle. We have operations in seven North American cities including six highly automated distribution centers. We also own and operate several leading e-commerce websites, and brick and mortar retail outlets and since October 1st 2019 we are the proud owners of a European office and distribution center in Amsterdam. With over 60 people currently working from Amsterdam, we try to expand our global footprint rapidly.

We work in a fast-paced and competitive industry that demands hard work and dedication, but we have built a unique company culture that allows our growing team of more than three hundred to support our success, each other, and surpass our goals all while having fun. Greenlane promotes from within, allowing driven candidates the ability to earn progressive roles and responsibilities.
What are the duties of the Logistics Manager?
The main duties of this position include, but are not limited to:
Responsible for the day-to-day relationship with the 3PL
Facilitate and ensure 3PL operations SLAs are met from the Greenlane perspective
Develop and maintain operational metrics/KPIs/scorecards
Organize all aspects of shipping from Country of Origin to the 3PL and select optimal carriers from 3PL to Customers per country
Oversee 3PL operating budget and work with management to ensure success
Create operational processes and apply continuous improvement methodology to support the business
Problem solve and troubleshoot operational issues to best support the business, including through cost analysis
Identify operational issues, find the root cause and take corrective action
Support all company infrastructure projects
Manage inventory with appropriate controls
Other duties as assigned by manager or designee
The Logistics Manager should have the following competencies:
Communication Skills - business proficient oral and verbal communications skills.

Interpersonal skills – exhibits care and concern for consumer issues, maintains confidentiality, exhibits tact and diplomacy, understands and practices ethical behavior, remains open to others ideas and exhibits willingness to try new things.
Planning and organizing – prioritizes and plans work activities and uses time efficiently. Possess problem solving skills and has a sense of responsibility.
Product and industry knowledge – deep knowledge of Greenlane’s product and industry developments
Quality control – demonstrates accuracy and thoroughness and monitors own work to ensure quality.
Adaptability – adapts to changes in the work environment, manages competing demands and is able to deal with frequent change, delays or unexpected events.
Dependability – is consistently at work and on time, follows instructions, responds to management direction and solicits feedback to improve performance.
Accuracy – must possess attention to detail.
Team Player – able to work within a team, but function individually
Our ideal Logistics Manager has the following skills and experience:
A proven track record in logistics
Experience managing 3PL operations
Experience with various WMS and Shipping systems
Experience with Microsoft D365, or other high-end ERP preferred
Contracting, negotiating, and change management
Accounting, budgeting, and cost control principles
5 to 10 years of professional experience, preferably in an international mid-sized company with a global product range
Experience in both B2C (eCommerce) and/or Wholesale with a broad collection of products (1000+)
Excellent time management and negotiation skills
Ability to work effectively with cross-functional teams
Proven experience in planning and execution
Preferably a degree (MBO-HBO) in logistics
Excellent knowledge of Dutch and English language, spoken and written
Residing in Amsterdam or surroundings.
If you feel that this vacancy was written just for you and you tick all the boxes.. we want you!
We will reach out to you within two weeks (14 days) after submitting your application to provide you with feedback.

wholesale,Indeed,p_ce4a066680e6c68f,Account executive - UK/DE,Optiply, Amsterdam Zuid,"When closing deals is life
Are you entrepreneurial, driven, and ambitious in sales? Then we are looking for you.
About Optiply

Optiply is a fast-growing company that supplies smart purchasing software mainly to webshops and wholesalers in the Netherlands. It is Software-as-a-Service where clients have a monthly subscription to the same system which is continuously developed. Our customer base consists of more than 300 webshops that vary from small starting companies to companies with hundreds of employees. We currently have almost 20 colleagues with whom we continuously work on further automating and optimizing the purchasing of our clients.
Job description:

As Account Executive/Sales Development you’ll be working in our sales team and you’ll be responsible for turning leads into customers. You will focus on the e-commerce and wholesale market where you follow up a combination of inbound and outbound leads and guide the entire sales process
column2: from cold calling to signing the contract.

column1: This is what you’ll be doing:
Approaching outbound leads (via LinkedIn, cold calls, etc.)
Follow up inbound leads
Giving product demos (online and / or on location)
Determining our wholesale sales strategy
Contract negotiations
Regular consultation with the sales and marketing team to coordinate inbound and outbound as much as possible
Take initiative in sharing your knowledge and expertise with regard to business development.
This is who we’re looking for:
Closing deals make your heart beat faster
You have 1-3 years of work experience in sales
You know what it takes to function well in a salesteam from previous experience (advantage: software companies)
You are passionate and you’re eager to learn
You are innovative, take initiative and think outside the box. You like a fast paced environment and dare to take risks
You like to work in a small fast-growing company where you see the results of your work every day
You have experience with German or UK market
You speak and write flawless German and English
This is what we offer:
Good salary with a nice bonus structure, training opportunities and many career opportunities
A beautiful workplace at one of the most beautiful locations in Amsterdam
Perfect balance of inside and outside sales
An awesome team so you always come home with a smile
column2:

column1: Are you entrepreneurial, driven, and ambitious in sales? Then we are looking for you.
About Optiply

Optiply is a fast-growing company that supplies smart purchasing software mainly to webshops and wholesalers in the Netherlands. It is Software-as-a-Service where clients have a monthly subscription to the same system which is continuously developed. Our customer base consists of more than 300 webshops that vary from small starting companies to companies with hundreds of employees. We currently have almost 20 colleagues with whom we continuously work on further automating and optimizing the purchasing of our clients.
Job description:

As Account Executive/Sales Development you’ll be working in our sales team and you’ll be responsible for turning leads into customers. You will focus on the e-commerce and wholesale market where you follow up a combination of inbound and outbound leads and guide the entire sales process
column2: from cold calling to signing the contract.

column1: This is what you’ll be doing:
Approaching outbound leads (via LinkedIn, cold calls, etc.)
Follow up inbound leads
Giving product demos (online and / or on location)
Determining our wholesale sales strategy
Contract negotiations
Regular consultation with the sales and marketing team to coordinate inbound and outbound as much as possible
Take initiative in sharing your knowledge and expertise with regard to business development.
This is who we’re looking for:
Closing deals make your heart beat faster
You have 1-3 years of work experience in sales
You know what it takes to function well in a salesteam from previous experience (advantage: software companies)
You are passionate and you’re eager to learn
You are innovative, take initiative and think outside the box. You like a fast paced environment and dare to take risks
You like to work in a small fast-growing company where you see the results of your work every day
You have experience with German or UK market
You speak and write flawless German and English
This is what we offer:
Good salary with a nice bonus structure, training opportunities and many career opportunities
A beautiful workplace at one of the most beautiful locations in Amsterdam
Perfect balance of inside and outside sales
An awesome team so you always come home with a smile

agriculture,Indeed,p_c5fb660485fb4a8f,Nutritionist - Feed,Cargill, Schiphol,Want to build a stronger, more sustainable future and cultivate your career? Join Cargill's global team of 155,000 employees who are committed to safe, responsible and sustainable ways to nourish the world. This position is in Cargill’s agricultural supply chain business, where we seamlessly connect farming customers with food, feed and industry.

column1: JOB PURPOSE AND IMPACT

The Nutritionist - Feed will provide advice and insights to internal stakeholders and our feed mill customers, while helping the business achieve growth targets. The business supplies feed ingredients to feed producers and you will make relevant connections between raw materials, the feed mill and animal performance at farm level.

You will become the go-to person for feed ingredient know-how and nutrient evaluation related questions. Ingredients in the portfolio include raw materials like grains (corn, wheat) and vegetable protein sources (sunflower, rape, soya).

We seek a collaborative and knowledgeable team player, who has a thorough understanding of feed ingredients & animal nutrition and who will support new business development projects and customer enquiries.
KEY ACCOUNTABILITIES
Acts as an educated resource to both customers and internal stakeholders in the field of feed ingredient specifications and applications.
Collaborates with commercial teams on providing product, application, ingredient, processing expertise and training.
Acts as the technical link between commercial teams and R&D function and assesses opportunities for improvement and provide advice and consultation.
Understand customers’ needs and help them to improve their business and animal performance at farm level, through our product solutions and services.
Support cross functional teams by compiling and analyzing data for projects.
Other duties as assigned.
MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS
Bachelor’s degree in a related field of agriculture, animal science, nutrition or business
Fluent in English
PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS
Experience in compound feed industry and connections in animal nutrition research institutes.
Our Offer

In return for your expertise and commitment, we will provide a fast paced stimulating international environment, which will stretch your abilities and channel your talents. We also offer competitive salary and benefits combined with outstanding career development opportunities in one of the largest and most solid private companies in the world.
Interested? Then make sure to send us your CV and cover letter in English today.
Follow us on LinkedIn: https://www.linkedin.com/company/cargill

Cargill is committed to being an inclusive employer. Click here to find out more: https://careers.cargill.com/diversity/",-1,-1,https://indeed.nl/rc/clk?jk=c5fb660485fb4a8f&from=vj&mvj=0&vjfrom=vjs&pos=bottom&astse=670a11a9eb36b130&assa=8085,https://nl.indeed.com/vacature-bekijken?jk=c5fb660485fb4a8f&fccid=d7d9a8241ba2f3ec&vjs=3,11 dagen geleden,11 dagen geleden,2021-04-07

JOB PURPOSE AND IMPACT

The Nutritionist - Feed will provide advice and insights to internal stakeholders and our feed mill customers, while helping the business achieve growth targets. The business supplies feed ingredients to feed producers and you will make relevant connections between raw materials, the feed mill and animal performance at farm level.

You will become the go-to person for feed ingredient know-how and nutrient evaluation related questions. Ingredients in the portfolio include raw materials like grains (corn, wheat) and vegetable protein sources (sunflower, rape, soya).

We seek a collaborative and knowledgeable team player, who has a thorough understanding of feed ingredients & animal nutrition and who will support new business development projects and customer enquiries.

Collaborates with commercial teams on providing product, application, ingredient, processing expertise and training.
Acts as the technical link between commercial teams and R&D function and assesses opportunities for improvement and provide advice and consultation.
Understand customers’ needs and help them to improve their business and animal performance at farm level, through our product solutions and services.
Support cross functional teams by compiling and analyzing data for projects.
Other duties as assigned.
MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS
Bachelor’s degree in a related field of agriculture, animal science, nutrition or business
Fluent in English
PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS
Experience in compound feed industry and connections in animal nutrition research institutes.
Our Offer

In return for your expertise and commitment, we will provide a fast paced stimulating international environment, which will stretch your abilities and channel your talents. agriculture,Indeed,p_e3f592d7bce8bc24,Nutritionist - Feed,Cargill, Schiphol,"Want to build a stronger, more sustainable future and cultivate your career? Join Cargill's global team of 155,000 employees who are committed to safe, responsible and sustainable ways to nourish the world. This position is in Cargill’s agricultural supply chain business, where we seamlessly connect farming customers with food, feed and industry.
JOB PURPOSE AND IMPACT

The Nutritionist - Feed will provide advice and insights to internal stakeholders and our feed mill customers, while helping the business achieve growth targets. The business supplies feed ingredients to feed producers and you will make relevant connections between raw materials, the feed mill and animal performance at farm level.

You will become the go-to person for feed ingredient know-how and nutrient evaluation related questions. Ingredients in the portfolio include raw materials like grains (corn, wheat) and vegetable protein sources (sunflower, rape, soya).

We seek a collaborative and knowledgeable team player, who has a thorough understanding of feed ingredients & animal nutrition and who will support new business development projects and customer enquiries.
KEY ACCOUNTABILITIES
Acts as an educated resource to both customers and internal stakeholders in the field of feed ingredient specifications and applications.
Collaborates with commercial teams on providing product, application, ingredient, processing expertise and training.
Acts as the technical link between commercial teams and R&D function and assesses opportunities for improvement and provide advice and consultation.
Understand customers’ needs and help them to improve their business and animal performance at farm level, through our product solutions and services.
Support cross functional teams by compiling and analyzing data for projects.
Other duties as assigned.
MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS
Bachelor’s degree in a related field of agriculture, animal science, nutrition or business
Fluent in English
PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS
Experience in compound feed industry and connections in animal nutrition research institutes.
Our Offer

In return for your expertise and commitment, we will provide a fast paced stimulating international environment, which will stretch your abilities and channel your talents. We also offer competitive salary and benefits combined with outstanding career development opportunities in one of the largest and most solid private companies in the world.

agriculture,Indeed,p_b19d78247084afff,Full Stack Developer,Farm21, Amsterdam,"Working to help solve the global food crisis.

Software innovates agriculture. In every step in the food production chain data is driving daily decisions. Farm21 focuses on optimizing farming processes pre-sowing until post-harvest. We use machine learning and algorithms to analyze data from our own sensors, integrated third party data and user feedback. Our Farm21 assistant provides farmers with advice on actions needed for optimal crop growing conditions. This results in less waste of valuable resources, optimal land use and better livelihood for farmers. That is the power of our IT.

We use our solution to optimize all farms across the world, including smallholder farmers. They are responsible for 80% of the food consumed in developing countries. We believe that they too need to be part of the digitalization of agriculture in order to solve the world food crisis. We help to increase their yields, providing them with a better income and the world with more food.

At Farm21 we operate in a small team, enabling us to develop new ideas quickly and innovate where we can. Our platform is the core of our company, making developers indispensable. Development of new features improves continuously due to our Agile way of working. Our developers are directly in contact with users and research partners, working together to achieve the main goal of feeding the world in 2050.
We’re reinventing our industry. We recently launched our solution which is spreading like wildfire. Sales has doubled our expectations. The farming industry is yearning for our products.
This is how it works.

As one of the first developers for Farm21 you are comfortable learning new things and working through stuff yourself. Since our team is small you help to build the foundation of Farm21’s DevOps. Show us that you’re good, and we’ll trust you to decide how something should work and when you’re going to do it. What you develop should always be meaningful. Therefore, you help to translate user needs into platform improvements.

As Farm21 is a spin-off of software company 7Lab, we are supported by their team of skilled developers. They know all ins and outs of our platform and current development process, since they developed the greater part of our platform so far.
Reasons you want to join Farm21.

You want to work at Farm21 because we are a small team that is open to new ideas and iterates quickly. Fast progress and room for mistakes, which we then solve together. Also, you are never mindlessly doing one single task for days on end. Variety is key.

At Farm21 we always have the customer's needs in mind. This keeps us focussed and on track. If you want to spend weeks on developing features that never make it live, you don’t want to work at Farm21.
We are social in the way we work together. We have our weeklies and our daily huddles, but we’re always there to discuss with and help each other.
We are social in the way we do business. Aiming to optimize one of the most valuable industries in the world, with the goal of contributing to solving the world food crisis ahead.
We have fun Friday afternoon drinks, a modern office, young & enthusiastic team and quite often fun company trips.

We value non-working hours. We rarely exceed the 40 hours workweek and on the off chance that we do, we make sure to treat ourselves with pizza & drinks or a decent breakfast. Also, we offer five weeks of paid leave (based on 40 hours workweek). Go and see the world, or go on staycation. Just don’t work when you're off, we won’t allow you.
We’re open to discuss working hours, or “working from home” days.
Practicalities.
We’re located in Amsterdam. Our office is very accessible by public transport. If you don’t live close we can help you with your daily commute.
Being able to speak Dutch is not necessary.
A daily freshly prepared lunch is on us.
We have standing desks. But if you prefer you can also sit down (We mostly sit down anyway).
What we ask from you.
Bachelor degree or higher.

Experience with Laravel and/or JavaScript is key. Knowledge of the other techniques is a plus. Some techniques we use: Laravel, Laravel Horizon, JavaScript (Angular, Vue), Docker, Rest API's and Bootstrap.

You can find yourself working in the Farm21 environment described above.",-1,-1,https://indeed.nl/rc/clk?jk=b19d78247084afff&from=vj&mvj=0&vjfrom=vjs&pos=bottom&astse=1d8d26b0b498ebe2&assa=8622,https://nl.indeed.com/vacature-bekijken?jk=b19d78247084afff&fccid=146abc7d6658301b&vjs=3,Meer dan 30 dagen geleden,Meer dan 30 dagen geleden,2021-04-13
agriculture,Indeed,p_e421885562e8e85f,Full Stack Developer,Farm21, Amsterdam,"Working to help solve the global food crisis.

Software innovates agriculture. In every step in the food production chain data is driving daily decisions. Farm21 focuses on optimizing farming processes pre-sowing until post-harvest. We use machine learning and algorithms to analyze data from our own sensors, integrated third party data and user feedback. Our Farm21 assistant provides farmers with advice on actions needed for optimal crop growing conditions. This results in less waste of valuable resources, optimal land use and better livelihood for farmers. That is the power of our IT.

We use our solution to optimize all farms across the world, including smallholder farmers. They are responsible for 80% of the food consumed in developing countries. We believe that they too need to be part of the digitalization of agriculture in order to solve the world food crisis. We help to increase their yields, providing them with a better income and the world with more food.

At Farm21 we operate in a small team, enabling us to develop new ideas quickly and innovate where we can. Our platform is the core of our company, making developers indispensable. Development of new features improves continuously due to our Agile way of working. Our developers are directly in contact with users and research partners, working together to achieve the main goal of feeding the world in 2050.
We’re reinventing our industry. We recently launched our solution which is spreading like wildfire. Sales has doubled our expectations. The farming industry is yearning for our products.
This is how it works.

As one of the first developers for Farm21 you are comfortable learning new things and working through stuff yourself. Since our team is small you help to build the foundation of Farm21’s DevOps. Show us that you’re good, and we’ll trust you to decide how something should work and when you’re going to do it. What you develop should always be meaningful. Therefore, you help to translate user needs into platform improvements.

As Farm21 is a spin-off of software company 7Lab, we are supported by their team of skilled developers. They know all ins and outs of our platform and current development process, since they developed the greater part of our platform so far.
Reasons you want to join Farm21.

You want to work at Farm21 because we are a small team that is open to new ideas and iterates quickly. Fast progress and room for mistakes, which we then solve together. Also, you are never mindlessly doing one single task for days on end. Variety is key.

At Farm21 we always have the customer's needs in mind. This keeps us focussed and on track. If you want to spend weeks on developing features that never make it live, you don’t want to work at Farm21.
We are social in the way we work together. We have our weeklies and our daily huddles, but we’re always there to discuss with and help each other.
We are social in the way we do business. Aiming to optimize one of the most valuable industries in the world, with the goal of contributing to solving the world food crisis ahead.

We’re open to discuss working hours, or “working from home” days.

Being able to speak Dutch is not necessary.
A daily freshly prepared lunch is on us.
We have standing desks. But if you prefer you can also sit down (We mostly sit down anyway).
What we ask from you.
Bachelor degree or higher.

Experience with Laravel and/or JavaScript is key. Knowledge of the other techniques is a plus. Some techniques we use: Laravel, Laravel Horizon, JavaScript (Angular, Vue), Docker, Rest API's and Bootstrap.

agriculture,Indeed,p_4fd6fec8f6114246,Full Stack Developer,Farm21, Amsterdam,"Working to help solve the global food crisis.

Software innovates agriculture. In every step in the food production chain data is driving daily decisions. Farm21 focuses on optimizing farming processes pre-sowing until post-harvest. We use machine learning and algorithms to analyze data from our own sensors, integrated third party data and user feedback. Our Farm21 assistant provides farmers with advice on actions needed for optimal crop growing conditions. This results in less waste of valuable resources, optimal land use and better livelihood for farmers. That is the power of our IT.

We use our solution to optimize all farms across the world, including smallholder farmers. They are responsible for 80% of the food consumed in developing countries. We believe that they too need to be part of the digitalization of agriculture in order to solve the world food crisis. We help to increase their yields, providing them with a better income and the world with more food.

At Farm21 we operate in a small team, enabling us to develop new ideas quickly and innovate where we can. Our platform is the core of our company, making developers indispensable. Development of new features improves continuously due to our Agile way of working. Our developers are directly in contact with users and research partners, working together to achieve the main goal of feeding the world in 2050.
We’re reinventing our industry. We recently launched our solution which is spreading like wildfire. Sales has doubled our expectations. The farming industry is yearning for our products.
This is how it works.

As one of the first developers for Farm21 you are comfortable learning new things and working through stuff yourself. Since our team is small you help to build the foundation of Farm21’s DevOps. Show us that you’re good, and we’ll trust you to decide how something should work and when you’re going to do it. What you develop should always be meaningful. Therefore, you help to translate user needs into platform improvements.

As Farm21 is a spin-off of software company 7Lab, we are supported by their team of skilled developers. They know all ins and outs of our platform and current development process, since they developed the greater part of our platform so far.
Reasons you want to join Farm21.

You want to work at Farm21 because we are a small team that is open to new ideas and iterates quickly. Fast progress and room for mistakes, which we then solve together. Also, you are never mindlessly doing one single task for days on end. Variety is key.

At Farm21 we always have the customer's needs in mind. This keeps us focussed and on track. If you want to spend weeks on developing features that never make it live, you don’t want to work at Farm21.
We are social in the way we work together. We have our weeklies and our daily huddles, but we’re always there to discuss with and help each other.
We are social in the way we do business. Aiming to optimize one of the most valuable industries in the world, with the goal of contributing to solving the world food crisis ahead.
We have fun Friday afternoon drinks, a modern office, young & enthusiastic team and quite often fun company trips.

We value non-working hours. We rarely exceed the 40 hours workweek and on the off chance that we do, we make sure to treat ourselves with pizza & drinks or a decent breakfast. Also, we offer five weeks of paid leave (based on 40 hours workweek). Go and see the world, or go on staycation. Just don’t work when you're off, we won’t allow you.
We’re open to discuss working hours, or “working from home” days.
Practicalities.
We’re located in Amsterdam. Our office is very accessible by public transport. If you don’t live close we can help you with your daily commute.
Being able to speak Dutch is not necessary.
A daily freshly prepared lunch is on us.
We have standing desks. But if you prefer you can also sit down (We mostly sit down anyway).
What we ask from you.
Bachelor degree or higher.

Experience with Laravel and/or JavaScript is key. Knowledge of the other techniques is a plus. Some techniques we use: Laravel, Laravel Horizon, JavaScript (Angular, Vue), Docker, Rest API's and Bootstrap.

You can find yourself working in the Farm21 environment described above.",-1,-1,https://indeed.nl/rc/clk?jk=b19d78247084afff&from=vj&mvj=0&vjfrom=vjs&pos=bottom&astse=1d8d26b0b498ebe2&assa=8622,https://nl.indeed.com/vacature-bekijken?jk=4fd6fec8f6114246&fccid=2dc83ad848ea3407&vjs=3,Meer dan 30 dagen geleden,Meer dan 30 dagen geleden,2021-04-13

You can find yourself working in the Farm21 environment described above.",-1,-1,https://indeed.nl/rc/clk?jk=b19d78247084afff&from=vj&mvj=0&vjfrom=vjs&pos=bottom&astse=1d8d26b0b498ebe2&assa=8622,https://nl.indeed.com/vacature-bekijken/pagead/clk?mo=r&ad=-6NYlbfkN0DB_wXt5TEGi6Sm0gC08ZqTlxryOAhj-44QmZ-XYjjJFgbdFJg1wUKdtSF0YYW4tGCqY9CUHtNedpeKYm2jXcMk1f8ZWdr2S8UhU7s9rR0F4dF2nn7496eStJipZfvDX4C97nPzeQtxGVMmW1x3CAxA5-IAgGoBOE1OZGRsN3cIq0mwvhUomamT9-L2HJ8PrW2JgIK0zvnpFfHr6vjiVKA8NFfT7pyfzP2oFaKrNWgM5zyTFAigBIOl-DGVKWrqDhGkkgnzCI9GFF7Eoo3IQv4cEeg7V-I-JZe-hViXItmTgXACpY8o9f9AJUYZeRH09DRLLbDrfaGxTIWKoHQSEetfFWtmPZP-9t3EvOT6pSN2hGlS5CgKaaOMqEajdt_Ycb6ZtVSWZnwZSqYiYAAKsLlqCjihp3-JcLaHIquB_TwkXJU82ZdmGBA4huFio9bFfU106wdx01c-IBkZ0A7EPTCVv3ZlbmDHYW8T-LoAPiOLSCf30m8f85fa&p=12&fvj=1&vjs=3,Meer dan 30 dagen geleden,Meer dan 30 dagen geleden,2021-04-13
agriculture,Indeed,p_197fd888281c3383,Full Stack Developer,Farm21, Amsterdam,"Working to help solve the global food crisis.

Software innovates agriculture. In every step in the food production chain data is driving daily decisions. Farm21 focuses on optimizing farming processes pre-sowing until post-harvest. We use machine learning and algorithms to analyze data from our own sensors, integrated third party data and user feedback. Our Farm21 assistant provides farmers with advice on actions needed for optimal crop growing conditions. This results in less waste of valuable resources, optimal land use and better livelihood for farmers. That is the power of our IT.

We use our solution to optimize all farms across the world, including smallholder farmers. They are responsible for 80% of the food consumed in developing countries. We believe that they too need to be part of the digitalization of agriculture in order to solve the world food crisis. We help to increase their yields, providing them with a better income and the world with more food.

At Farm21 we operate in a small team, enabling us to develop new ideas quickly and innovate where we can. Our platform is the core of our company, making developers indispensable. Development of new features improves continuously due to our Agile way of working. Our developers are directly in contact with users and research partners, working together to achieve the main goal of feeding the world in 2050.
We’re reinventing our industry. We recently launched our solution which is spreading like wildfire. Sales has doubled our expectations. The farming industry is yearning for our products.
This is how it works.

As one of the first developers for Farm21 you are comfortable learning new things and working through stuff yourself. Since our team is small you help to build the foundation of Farm21’s DevOps. Show us that you’re good, and we’ll trust you to decide how something should work and when you’re going to do it. What you develop should always be meaningful. Therefore, you help to translate user needs into platform improvements.

As Farm21 is a spin-off of software company 7Lab, we are supported by their team of skilled developers. They know all ins and outs of our platform and current development process, since they developed the greater part of our platform so far.
Reasons you want to join Farm21.

You want to work at Farm21 because we are a small team that is open to new ideas and iterates quickly. Fast progress and room for mistakes, which we then solve together. Also, you are never mindlessly doing one single task for days on end. Variety is key.

At Farm21 we always have the customer's needs in mind. This keeps us focussed and on track. If you want to spend weeks on developing features that never make it live, you don’t want to work at Farm21.
We are social in the way we work together. We have our weeklies and our daily huddles, but we’re always there to discuss with and help each other.
We are social in the way we do business. Aiming to optimize one of the most valuable industries in the world, with the goal of contributing to solving the world food crisis ahead.
We have fun Friday afternoon drinks, a modern office, young & enthusiastic team and quite often fun company trips.

We value non-working hours. We rarely exceed the 40 hours workweek and on the off chance that we do, we make sure to treat ourselves with pizza & drinks or a decent breakfast. Also, we offer five weeks of paid leave (based on 40 hours workweek). Go and see the world, or go on staycation. Just don’t work when you're off, we won’t allow you.
We’re open to discuss working hours, or “working from home” days.
Practicalities.
We’re located in Amsterdam. Our office is very accessible by public transport. If you don’t live close we can help you with your daily commute.
Being able to speak Dutch is not necessary.
A daily freshly prepared lunch is on us.
We have standing desks. But if you prefer you can also sit down (We mostly sit down anyway).
What we ask from you.
Bachelor degree or higher.

Experience with Laravel and/or JavaScript is key. Knowledge of the other techniques is a plus. Some techniques we use: Laravel, Laravel Horizon, JavaScript (Angular, Vue), Docker, Rest API's and Bootstrap.

You can find yourself working in the Farm21 environment described above.",-1,-1,https://indeed.nl/rc/clk?jk=b19d78247084afff&from=vj&mvj=0&vjfrom=vjs&pos=bottom&astse=1d8d26b0b498ebe2&assa=8622,https://nl.indeed.com/vacature-bekijken?jk=197fd888281c3383&fccid=e5ea1ff710ce39ca&vjs=3,Meer dan 30 dagen geleden,Meer dan 30 dagen geleden,2021-04-13

teacher,Indeed,p_9f2e815c9ad928ed,Mandarin / Chinese teacher & optional Chinese cooking teacher,Lumen XL BV, Amsterdam,"We are looking for a Chinese teacher to teach Chinese to our company director Jeroen. He already passed HSK 1, 2, 3 and 4. But he needs to refresh it and then his goal is to eventually obtain HSK 5. Writing with a pen is not important, but to learn to select the right characters via pinyin is relevant. Of course his vocal skills and listening ability are top priority. Jeroen wants to improve his Chinese, so he can better talk directly with Chinese factory bosses while visiting China. This will help him more easily build a meaningful partnership with them to improve mutual understanding and eventually to help grow his business.In order to cultivate a Chinese learning environment the more Chinese talk the better. So from this perspective Jeroen is also interested in getting Chinese cooking classes in Chinese.You don't need to have a teaching or cooking education for this job. But you need to be fluent in Chinese and to be good at cooking is of course a plus. The job might be perfect for a student. It is just for once a week.Location: Amsterdam city center我们期待您的申请!Soort dienstverband: Tijdelijk, Bepaalde tijdSalaris: €12,00 - €18,00 per uurArbeidsvoorwaarden:ReiskostenvergoedingWerkschema:AvondwerkWeekendThuiswerken:Nee",-1,-1,https://indeed.nljavascript:void(0)

column1: teacher,Indeed,p_17a720b2267908fa,Early Years Group 1 Classroom Teacher,Amstelland International School, Amstelveen,"Primary School Teacher(Temporary position 1 February 2021 - 31 July 2021)Due to the rapid growth of our school, we have a job opportunity for a full-time (1 FTE) Early years Primary School Teacher. Start date:  1 February 2021.Salary scale according to Dutch primary school teachers labour law (CAO) L10 (min. €2687,- max. €4113,- full-time per month, bruto salary (before tax). About the AISThe AIS is a Dutch International Primary and Secondary School (DIPS) situated in Amstelveen. AIS is the international school department which forms part of a larger Dutch school group Onderwijsgroep Amstelland. Together we are a family of thirteen schools, one of which is a language school Taalschool Amstelland which we collaborate closely with. The AIS is subsidised by the Dutch government, this enables us to deliver accessible high quality international education. At the AIS we teach the International Primary Curriculum (IPC). AIS is a start up school and has recently opened its doors a year ago to a diverse community of professionals & learners.Vision Statement International education which inspires creative thinking, provoking children to become curious and take ownership of their learning.Mission StatementAmstelland International School is dedicated to establishing a learning community which empowers student voice, invests in nurturing relationships, fosters compassion for humanity and inspires a shared responsibility of our planet.School values: · Curiosity· Community· Agency · Relationships· Responsibility*AIS is an advocate for child protection and safe-guarding, relevant procedures to ensure the safety of our community are conducted with care.You need to be: An innovative and creative teacher with an understanding of inquiry-based learning.Able to contribute to a compassionate school community and work as part of a dynamic and committed team.Flexible and open to new ideas.A passionate learner, continuously embracing new learning opportunities.Teaching philosophy inspired by Reggio Emilia approach to learning.Able to differentiate, gearing your teaching towards students with diverse academic, language, social, emotional rights.Compassionate and welcoming to diverse cultural backgrounds and traditions.Willingness to learn the Dutch language.Willing to provide a police clearance from every country of employment.Required: An extensive understanding of Early Years & play based learning.A commitment to the school’s mission, vision and school values.Native speaker or fluent in spoken and written English.A valid and relevant Primary school teaching qualification i.e. Duo certified, QTS, PGCE.Duo accredited teaching qualifications.Bachelors in Primary education, Masters of education is preferred.At least five years’ primary school teaching experience.At least two years international school teaching experience.A European work visa.Experience with an international educational programme (e.g. IB PYP, IPC, concept based curriculum, project based teaching & learning, understanding of Reggio Emilia approach)Excellent knowledge and experience of different teaching and educational methodologies.An understanding and knowledge of inter-cultural education.The ability and initiative to contribute towards creating and implementing school policy.Excellent communication skills and ability to function well within a team.A great sense of humour.Applications are required to be submitted before 31 January 2021. Address the application to Mrs J. Da Silva, Director of Amstelland International School.AIS reserves the right to interview candidates before the closing date. Due to the large number of applications
column2: should you not receive a response from our recruiting team within two months upon applying, please consider you application unsuccessful on this occasion.Contractduur 6 maandenDeadline sollicitaties: 24-1-2021Verwachte startdatum: 25-1-2021Job Types: Full-time, TemporaryExperience:International curriculum : 3 years (Required)",-1,-1,https://indeed.nljavascript:void(0)
column3: ,https://nl.indeed.com/vacature-bekijken/company/Amstelland-International-School/jobs/Early-Years-Group-Classroom-Teacher-17a720b2267908fa?fccid=de954967cacdc362&vjs=3,28 dagen geleden,28 dagen geleden,2021-01-26

column1: teacher,Indeed,p_89463282ddec8492,Classroom teacher for new International Crossover Class,Hermann Wesselink College," Amstelveen zuid, Bovenkerk","Classroom teacher for new International Crossover Class(grade 5/6 level – full time - start April 2021)Does developing a new initiative and guiding young learners towards internationally minded secondary education intrigue you? We’re looking for an innovative educator who has experience with the international primary or middle years programme with strong collaboration skills, as you will be working closely with the Hermann Wesselink College (HWC) in Amstelveen setting up the International Crossover Class for children aged 11 and 12 which will start in March 2021.What is the International Crossover Class?The ICC offers high quality education for international students who want to start or continue studying an international curriculum. Children aged 11 or 12 who are new to the Netherlands and have not yet decided whether they want to enter Dutch, bilingual or international education, are welcome to join. In the Netherlands the first year of high school is for 12-year-olds. Children in this age group are not allowed to attend a Dutch primary school (group 8) or secondary school (grade 6) because they don’t speak the Dutch language or because they are too young. Therefore, new students who want to enter Dutch secondary education have to attend an intermediate year (language class) first to learn the Dutch language. If they prefer international education, the ICC could be a suitable place to start.The ICC offers an innovative curriculum. We will be following the International Middle Years Curriculum (IMYC). The language of instruction is English. A minimum of two Dutch lessons is also offered to our students as part of their integration in the Dutch culture. Our initiative supports all students who are in a transitional year between primary and secondary education. The Hermann Wesselink College currently offers secondary education in two main streams: Dutch and bilingual. They are enthusiastic to launch the ICC working in close collaboration with Amstelland International Primary School. The HWC already welcomes a large number of international students.If you are: · a creative and innovative teacher with the understanding of and experience with inquiry-based learning
column2: · highly skilled in implementing positive behaviour strategies, embracing global citizenship, diversity and understanding the needs of international children
column3: · passionate about developing a growth mindset and inspiring children to become curious about their learning processes
column4: · by nature an educator who believes in differentiation and understands multiple learning styles creating a strong framework in which your students can thrive
column5: · as curious about the Dutch culture and host country as your students will be
column6: · compassionate, kind, helpful, flexible, open to new ideas and a good sense of humour
column7: · by nature a leader, an innovator and a team player.Required: · Qualified Teacher Status: DUO accreditation permitting you to teach this particular age group. Dual competence, both primary and secondary school teaching qualification is a plus
column8: · fluent in spoken and written English
column9: · preferably specialist experience in the IMYC or IB MYP
column10: · 3 to 5 years international (primary and/or 1st or 2nd year secondary) school teaching experience
column12: · excellent knowledge and experience of different teaching and educational methodologies
column13: · excellent interpersonal, organisational and class management skills
column14: · the ability to seek contact and take the initiative to work closely with the Hermann Wesselink College and your future colleagues
column15: · the willingness to collaborate with Amstelland International School and team
column16: · in the process of learning the Dutch language or proficient in Dutch
column17: · provide a police clearance (Verklaring Omtrent Gedrag).Salary scale according to Dutch primary school labour law (CAO) L10 (min. € 2678 max. € 4113 full-time).All non-Dutch teaching qualifications must be verified by DUO. We are not able to employ a teacher until this process has been completed. Details of how qualifications can be verified are to be found on the DUO website via the link.Has this vacancy sparked your enthusiasm? Please send your application to the attention of Mrs. Wendy van Vliet with a letter of motivation along with your CV and contact details of two professional references. For a quick view of the Hermann Wesselink College and Amstelland International School, you can visit the websites. Please click here and here. Your references will only be contacted if you are in the final selection. All applications are required to be written in English and submitted before 1 February 2021.Deadline sollicitaties: 1-2-2021Verwachte startdatum: 1-4-2021Job Types: Full-time, ContractSalary: From €2,678.00 per monthExperience:international education: 4 years (Required)Work Remotely:No",-1,-1,https://indeed.nljavascript:void(0)

column1: teacher,Indeed,p_d7a31e8f89f076c5,Course Leader,EF Education First, Amsterdam Zuid,"As an EF Course Leader you will travel abroad with a group of students during the school holidays. The trips last from two to four weeks depending on the course and the destination. You will have to be available for the students whenever they need you. Together you will do lots of different activities, dance at discos, play football or just hang out at the beach.

You will work in an international environment where you will meet and work with people from all over the world. The students are between 10-18 years old and they study English, Spanish, German or French (ADAPT AGES & LANGUAGES TO YOUR MARKET). Even though there are lots of fun activities and excursions already planned for the students, YOU will make a great impact on the students’ experience by being a great leader!
Hiring Manager – Sales Office
Line Manager – Destination Office
Your key tasks will consist of, but not be limited to:
Travelling together with a group of students to/from the destination

Work as part of an international team – during the trip you will report to the local manager and together with colleagues from the local team and other Course Leaders you will look after an international group of students. All students in the destination are all our responsibility.
Assisting with student arrivals and departures.
On-going promotion of activities and encouragement of student participation.
Conducting daily meetings with students after lessons to communicate information regarding activity choices, meeting times and places and upcoming events.
Attending and running all activities for your group. Do research about different activities and plan your stay and the activity chart together with local staff.
Collecting money for bus passes and optional excursions.
Monitoring daily attendance and keeping up to date records and paperwork.
Attending all leader meetings.
Participating in the duty rotas when required.
Ensuring students follow the safety rules set as well that the EF behaviour code is followed by students at all times and inform management immediately if there are any issues or problems.
Be available for the students 24/7. There may be situations where you have to make quick decisions as a leader.
Work late hours, for example at the discos.
Dealing with problems, welfare and emergency situations should they arise.
Requirements
Enthusiastic, organised and a natural leader.
Experience of working with young people (example given: teacher, scout leader).
Excellent interpersonal skills.
Capable of using your own initiative.
Responsible and flexible.
Fluent in (INSERT THE MARKET LANGUAGE) and the language spoken in the course’s destination country (e.g English, Spanish, German, French).
Attend training prior to your contract commencing.
About EF Education First

At EF we believe that the world is better when people try to understand one another. Since 1965, we have helped millions of people see new places, experience new cultures, and learn new things about the world and about themselves. Our culturally immersive education programs—focused on language, travel, cultural exchange, and academics—turn dreams into international opportunities.

When you join EF, you join a multicultural and diverse community working across more than 600 schools and offices in 50 countries, all with one shared mission of opening the world through education. Whoever you are, whatever you are passionate about—we welcome you and want you to bring that to work every day. EF is proud to be an equal opportunity employer and we are committed to inclusion and belonging across race, ethnicity, gender, age, religion, parental status, identity, experience and everything else that makes you unique.

Founded in Sweden in 1965, EF has school and offices around the world, including hubs in Boston, London, Mexico City, São Paulo, Shanghai, Stockholm, Zürich, and more. Learn more at https://ef.com.",-1,-1,https://indeed.nl/rc/clk?jk=d7a31e8f89f076c5&from=vj&mvj=0&vjfrom=vjs&pos=bottom&astse=c1be2c06df373a3c&assa=910,https://nl.indeed.com/vacature-bekijken?jk=d7a31e8f89f076c5&fccid=b73e8c57e5544151&vjs=3,28 dagen geleden,28 dagen geleden,2021-01-26

teacher,Indeed,p_8edbc50c85bade02,Customer Support Agent (DE),Fairphone, Amsterdam,"Fairphone is a social enterprise driving change in the electronics industry from the inside out. Our business model is based on social values and securing continuity and centers around producing and marketing smartphones in a way that puts social and environmental values first.

We are looking for a hands-on German speaking Customer Support Agent to become part of our growing team of passionate people who work to achieve our mission. If you are as excited as we are about creating positive change, then have a look at our vacancy below.
LOCATION: Amsterdam · HOURS: 40 hours/week · START: ASAP · DEADLINE TO APPLY: 31.01.2021
About your Role
The Fairphone Community is the main focus of our support team.

As our 1st line Customer Support Agent, you will be a Fairphone ambassador, providing our customers with the best service: you will meet our (potential) customers’ needs over the phone and via email, using your technical expertise, creativity, passion and active listening. You will listen, offer advice, turn around experiences when needed and provide relevant feedback to others within our company, influencing changes in different teams and processes!
Your Profile
You are excited about helping people! You are a problem-solver at heart and understand how important technology is nowadays in everyday life.
You show ownership as well as the ability to effectively prioritize and manage your time and tasks.
You are a quick learner and have the required skills to escalate technical challenges with other relevant departments within Fairphone.
You are a great teammate who likes to collaborate and have a positive attitude.
You are adaptable with changes - Fairphone is a dynamic, fast paced, multicultural environment.
You feel a strong connection with Fairphone’s mission and values.
You live or are willing to live in the Netherlands and have the nationality of an EU/EEA country or Switzerland.
Your Responsibilities

You will be the friendly voice of Fairphone, providing effective troubleshooting and personal support, addressing both hardware and software related issues, over different support channels: Zendesk, Sprout, telephone and occasionally in person.
You solve our community requests through the whole customer journey.
You escalate complex issues to 2nd line support.
You proactively identify ways to avoid recurrence of customer issues by regularly reviewing the processes and recommending changes.
You will be multitasking through multiple systems while troubleshooting with customers.
You will have to meet average handle time, NPS scores as well as schedule adherence to make sure we support our community in the most efficient way!
Your Skills & Experiences
You have at least 2 years of experience in customer facing roles, of which 12-18 months in Customer Support.
You have excellent customer service skills: you are empathetic, accurate, compassionate, responsive, resourceful, proactive.
You love troubleshooting technology! Experience with ticket systems like Zendesk, order management systems, and chat support is a plus.
You have strong written and verbal communication skills and are able to adapt your communication style to different customers.
You have the ability to use critical thinking and logic skills to isolate and resolve technical issues in a timely manner.
You have good time management and prioritization skills.
You are fluent in English and in one of the following languages:
You are fluent in both English and German. Speaking more than 2 of these languages is a plus!
Your future Team: Our Customer Support Team
Alberto
Andre
Berit
Elena
Esmee
Halle
Joana
Krish
Maud
Miriam
Patricia
Rachel
What can Fairphone offer you?
The opportunity to create an impact in the electronics industry around the world.
A diverse work environment full of international, passionate, warm hearted team members in the heart of Amsterdam.
You will join Fairphone’s collective pension scheme and we will contribute to build your pension.
You will also receive the following benefits once the coronavirus measures are over:
Daily, healthy lunch, organic FairChain coffee, and many more tasty things for a low, monthly contribution.
Public transport allowance – we support you if you come by public transport.
Bike allowance – we support you for a bike purchase with up to 300 Euros. We also offer in-house bike repairs.
Weekly Yoga sessions at the office.
Weekly Bootcamp sessions with personal trainer.

Seasonal Dutch lessons with a language teacher at the office.",-1,-1,https://indeed.nl/rc/clk?jk=8edbc50c85bade02&from=vj&mvj=0&vjfrom=vjs&pos=bottom&astse=dcfab3e5ddf115a2&assa=3202,https://nl.indeed.com/vacature-bekijken?jk=8edbc50c85bade02&fccid=dda10d8219cc4844&vjs=3,28 dagen geleden,28 dagen geleden,2021-01-26

teacher,Indeed,p_754160a8514e07cb,Chemistry Teacher - online education,StudyTree, Amsterdam,"In shortDo you have experience in education, is your English up to standard and would you like to teach students in an international setting? Are you independent, able to take initiative and would you like to keep developing yourself? Then we are looking for you!In this position, you will be bringing international students up to VWO 6 level in one year. Throughout this year the students follow several courses and we are looking for enthusiastic and motivated people to join our teaching team for the course Chemistry.Daily activitiesYou will teach a class or multiple classes of approximately 12 international students. This requires thorough preparation, which you can plan flexibly yourself. Besides you will also working on developing videos so students can study at home. During the year, you’ll create exams, administer and check them. You will be in regular contact with your colleagues about the content of the lessons and the students’ progress. In addition, you will handle the cultural differences in the group enthusiastically and participate in activities inside and outside the lessons to help the students integrate.Who we are looking forEssential for this position is that you have substantive knowledge of Chemistry. Experience with teaching, for example tutoring, is a big plus. You enjoy being in front of a group and teaching people something. It is a requirement that your English in speech and writing is at a sufficient level. We are looking for someone with enthusiasm and a great sense of responsibility, who can work independently and has a proactive attitude.Who we areStudyTree focuses on the educational development of students. We support educational institutions in developing lesson programs and teaching classes with the help of flexibly deployable (student) teachers. We train and guide our teachers and always work closely with our clients. Our clients range from primary to higher education, from regular to private education. We work a lot with enthusiastic people who see plenty of opportunities and are have the ambition to contribute to education.We offer: – Driven and fun colleagues in an international setting
column2: – Plenty of room for your own input and autonomy
column3: – Opportunities for personal development
column4: – An employment contract of approximately 10 hours per week
column5: – Flexible working hours
column6: – Good salary.We ask: – Third-year university student or graduate
